snippet: The world has reacted mostly with disbelief that a superpower could fall into such dysfunction.
abstract: Countries around the world react mostly with disbelief, fear, dismay--and some gloating--over Washington's shutdown and march toward default; many nations, especially those that have had their own financial crises, express shock and anger that American lawmakers could let problem reach such a point and worry over global suffering to come.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Paulina Villegas from Mexico City, Andrew Roth and Patrick Reevell from Moscow, Niki Kitsantonis from Athens, Jonathan Gilbert from Buenos Aires, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The world has reacted mostly with disbelief that a superpower could fall into such dysfunction.

headline.main: Viewing U.S. in Fear and Dismay
headline.print_headline: Viewing U.S. in Fear and Dismay
